Crimes.Violation_Type: Exclusion from Convention refugee status under Article 1(E)
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Vifansi is excluded from refugee status due to alleged 'official status' in the U.S.
Crimes.Governing_Law: Article 1(E) of the UN Refugee Convention
Crimes.Application_Facts: Vifansi fled U.S. criminal charges and lost re-entry rights; Board assumed 'official status' without proper assessment.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board's decision was flawed due to misapprehension of facts and law.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge the Boardâ€™s decision.
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court allowed the application, quashed the decision, and remitted for redetermination.
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Fled U.S. prosecution and entered Canada to seek refugee protection
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Rights and obligations akin to nationality under Article 1(E)
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Existence of rights and obligations conferred by U.S. authorities
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: UN Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees, Article 1(E)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Misinterpretation of facts by the Immigration and Refugee Board
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not central; error based on legal interpretation and fact misapprehension
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Evidence that Vifansi lost asylum protection and re-entry rights in the U.S.
Crimes.Application_Basis: Claim based on imputed political opinion and fear of persecution
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and extent of rights in the U.S.
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Article 1(E) excludes those with rights/obligations similar to nationals in country of former residence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board failed to assess actual rights held in the U.S.
Crimes.Outcome: Application allowed; decision quashed and remitted
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of being returned to U.S. without fair assessment of refugee claim
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refugee claim denied due to incorrect assumption of 'official status' in the U.S.
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board ignored evidence regarding loss of U.S. status
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None; issue was misapplication of exclusion clause
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to properly consider evidence on U.S. immigration status
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to criminal charges and loss of status
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: No finding of misrepresentation; issue was legal error
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Jurisdiction of Canadian refugee determination system over foreign criminal conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evaluation of U.S. immigration consequences
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Error in law due to unfounded assumption of 'official status'
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Board misapprehended key facts about applicant's U.S. status

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee status eligibility following criminal conduct abroad
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether possession of stolen vehicle affects refugee claim under Article 1(E)
Crimes.Governing_Law: Article 1(E) of the UN Refugee Convention
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board failed to assess whether applicant retained rights in the U.S.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board incorrectly excluded applicant based on presumed 'official status'
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish refugee status; on Minister to prove exclusion
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not central; decision based on legal error
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Article 1(E) excludes persons with rights and obligations akin to nationality
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly analyze applicant's actual immigration standing in the U.S.
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim not decided on merits due to procedural and legal errors
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unfair due to misapprehension of material facts
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Loss of asylum protection and re-entry rights in the U.S.
Crimes.Legal_Framework: UN Refugee Convention, Canadian immigration law
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Board's factual and legal conclusions
Crimes.Court_Result: Decision quashed and remitted for reconsideration
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Argued lack of 'official status' in the U.S. due to criminal charges
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence on U.S. immigration status
Crimes.Outcome: Remanded for redetermination by a different panel
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (Federal Court jurisdiction over IRB decisions)

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim exclusion based on foreign criminal conduct
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Impact of fleeing prosecution on refugee eligibility under Article 1(E)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board failed to assess actual rights held in the U.S. post-charges
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Incorrect denial based on presumed 'official status'
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On Minister to prove exclusion under Article 1(E)
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not primary issue; legal error dominated
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Article 1(E) exclusion applies only if individual holds rights akin to nationality
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Misapprehension of facts regarding U.S. status
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on imputed political opinion
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached due to procedural error
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unfair due to failure to assess relevant facts
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence that applicant lost U.S. asylum protection and re-entry rights
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee law and international obligations
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged credibility findings and legal interpretation
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Denied having 'official status' in the U.S. after fleeing charges
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony and documentation on immigration history
